chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

Goal:
ring_theory Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq

Premises:
Notation Zp := Zp_zero
ring_theory : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> Prop
Zp_mult = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in fun H0 : Z_Zp => let (y, _) := H0 in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (x * y) p) (div_rem_spec2 (x * y) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
Zp_plus = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in fun H0 : Z_Zp => let (y, _) := H0 in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (x + y) p) (div_rem_spec2 (x + y) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
Notation Op := Zp_one
Zp_minus : forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp
Zp_plus_zero : forall x, Zp ⊕ x = x
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy...
Zp_plus_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊕ y ⊕ z
Zp_plus_comm : forall x y, x ⊕ y = y ⊕ x
Zp_zero = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) 0 ((fun lemma : 0 < p <-> (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 < p) (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z lt Z.of_nat Z.lt Nat2Z.inj_lt 0 0%Z eq_refl p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl) (let Hp0 : Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl 0 0%Z eq_refl)) Hp in let cstr : (0...
Zp_mult_plus_distr_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊗ y ⊕ x ⊗ z
Zp_mult_plus_distr_r : forall x y z : Z_Zp, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x
QArith_base.Q_Setoid = {| RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive := fun x : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qeq_refl x; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Symmetric := fun (x y : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) => QArith_base.Qeq_sym x y H; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive := fun (x y z : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) (H0 : QArith_base.Qeq y z) => QArith_base.Qeq_trans x y z H H0 |} : RelationClasses.Equivalence QArith_base.Qeq
Zp_mult_one : forall x, Op ⊗ x = x
Zp_mult_one_r : forall x, x ⊗ Op = x
M22_opp_mult_r : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult x (MI22 Ropp y) = MI22 Ropp (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y)
Zp_one = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) (rem 1 p) (div_rem_spec2 1 Hp) : Z_Zp
mk_rt : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), (forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)) -> (forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)) ->...-> ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
get_signZ_th = {| sign_spec := fun c : Z => match c as z return (forall c' : Z, get_signZ z = Some c' -> Zeq_bool z (- c') = true) with | 0%Z => fun (c' : Z) (H : get_signZ 0 = Some c') => let H0 : False := eq_ind (get_signZ 0) (fun e : option Z => match e with | Some _ => False | None => True end) I (Some c') H in False_ind (Zeq_bool 0 (- c') = true) H0 | Z.pos p => fun (c' : Z) (H : get_signZ (Z.pos p) = Some c') => let H0 : False := eq_ind (get_signZ (Z.pos p)) (fun e : option Z => match e with | Some _ => False | None => True end) I (Some c') H in False_ind (Zeq_bool (Z.pos p) (- c')...
M22plus_assoc : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y u : M22 R, PL22 Rplus x (PL22 Rplus y u) = PL22 Rplus (PL22 Rplus x y) u
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
M22_mult_distr_l : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y u : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult x (PL22 Rplus y u) = PL22 Rplus (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y) (MU22 Rplus Rmult x u)
QArith_base.Qminus = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qplus x (QArith_base.Qopp y) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q Arguments QArith_base.Qminus (_ _)%Q_scope
M22mult_assoc : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y u : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult x (MU22 Rplus Rmult y u) = MU22 Rplus Rmult (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y) u
M22_opp_mult_l : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult (MI22 Ropp x) y = MI22 Ropp (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y)
M22scal_MU22_r : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall (k : R) (x y : M22 R), M22scal Rmult k (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y) = MU22 Rplus Rmult x (M22scal Rmult k y)
Det22_mult : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y : M22 R, Det22 Rplus Rmult Ropp (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y) = Rmult (Det22 Rplus Rmult Ropp x) (Det22 Rplus Rmult Ropp y)
QArith_base.Qplus = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => {| QArith_base.Qnum := QArith_base.Qnum x * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden y) + QArith_base.Qnum y * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden x); QArith_base.Qden := QArith_base.Qden x * QArith_base.Qden y |} : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q Arguments QArith_base.Qplus (_ _)%Q_scope
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr N * Ring_polynom.PExpr N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe2
QArith_base.Qmult_comm : forall x y : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq (QArith_base.Qmult x y) (QArith_base.Qmult y x)
QArith_base.Qplus_comm : forall x y : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq (QArith_base.Qplus x y) (QArith_base.Qplus y x)
QArith_base.Qplus_assoc : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq (QArith_base.Qplus x (QArith_base.Qplus y z)) (QArith_base.Qplus (QArith_base.Qplus x y) z)
M22scal_PL22 : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall (k : R) (x y : M22 R), M22scal Rmult k (PL22 Rplus x y) = PL22 Rplus (M22scal Rmult k x) (M22scal Rmult k y)
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
